message:
Nice interview with one of gaming's genuine visionaries about the future of the medium:

http://www.next-gen.biz/features/phil-harrison-future
Nice article. There is a looming battle ahead in the way gaming content gets delivered to consumers, and who the dominate players will be. The next ten years should be very interesting indeed.

I look forward is seeing what the iPad 3 will look like performance wise. All they really need to do as well is create a device which can be mobile and hook-up to your TV like the iPad 2 currently can do.

Then they just need to enable blutooth capable controllers and bobs your uncle. Instant new console, with access to thousands of games. They also have the digital infrastructure already in place for movies, music and more.

Apple is also sitting on $70 billion dollars in cash at present. So they can pretty much do whatever they want to.

You have to think by the time the PS4/Xbox 720 comes out they just might be another home console competitor other than Nintendo.
